text: The West Frisian Islands (Dutch: Waddeneilanden, West Frisian: Waadeilannen) art of the Frisian Islands. They are in the North Sea in the northern part of the Netherlands. They are the following: 1\. Five big islands: * Ameland * Schiermonnikoog * Terschelling * Texel * Vlieland 2\. Five small and uninhabited islands: * Griend * Noorderhaaks / Razende Bol * Rottumeroog * Rottumerplaat * Zuiderduintjes 3\. Various sandbars: * Engelsmanplaat * Richel * Rif * Simonszand * etc. The majority of the islands and sandbars are in the province of Friesland. Exceptions are: * Noorderhaaks and Texel lie in the province of North Holland (most western islands). * Simonszand, Rottumerplaat, Rottumeroog and Zuiderduintjes lie in the province of Groningen (most eastern islands). Category:Friesland Category:Groningen (province) Category:North Holland
title: West Frisian Islands
